sentences.english: Both charges would be misdemeanors, Guidotti said.
sentences.chinese: 兩項指控都將是輕罪，圭多提指出。

sentences.english: Crimes are usually classified as felonies and misdemeanors.
sentences.chinese: 犯罪通常分爲重罪與輕罪。

sentences.english: Ambling and strolling is a misdemeanor.
sentences.chinese: 漫步和散步是一項輕罪。

sentences.english: Exposing yourself in Japan would apparently come under the ambit of a public indecency crime or a misdemeanor.
sentences.chinese: 在日本暴露自己顯然受制於公開猥褻罪的範圍或輕罪。

sentences.english: Because of one minor offence he was branded as a common criminal.
sentences.chinese: 由於一個輕罪，他被加上臭名昭著的罪犯的污名。

sentences.english: The case is now being investigated as filing a false report, a misdemeanor.
sentences.chinese: 警方現已將此案定性爲謊報案情的輕罪行爲。

sentences.english: Floyd also has four misdemeanors which include battery and three counts of harassment, says the local DA.
sentences.chinese: 小梅也有四個輕罪，包括毆打和三個騷擾罪。

sentences.english: There is no division in civil law comparable to that between felonies and misdemeanors in the criminal system.
sentences.chinese: 在民法中，沒有像刑法體系中關於重罪和輕罪的區別。

sentences.english: Committing a forgery is a felony, but driving an automobile in excess of the speed limit is a misdemeanor.
sentences.chinese: 進行僞造是犯重罪，但超速駕駛屬於輕罪。

sentences.english: Felonies are more serious crimes than misdemeanors.
sentences.chinese: 重罪與輕罪相比是要嚴重許多的犯罪。

sentences.english: He faces misdemeanor counts of stalking and harassment.
sentences.chinese: 他面臨跟蹤和騷擾等數宗輕罪指控。

sentences.english: She was charged with a misdemeanour, that of carrying a concealed weapon.
sentences.chinese: 她被指控犯有身上藏有武器的輕罪。

sentences.english: They are charged criminally with reckless conduct, a misdemeanor.
sentences.chinese: 她們被指控犯了不良行爲罪，一種輕罪。

sentences.english: An offense or a misdemeanor; a misdeed.
A Michigan woman is being charged with a misdemeanor offense and is facing up to 93 days in jail.
sentences.chinese: 密歇根州一名婦女被控犯有可判入獄93天的輕罪。

definition: lit. to return the jade annulus to Zhao (idiom); fig. to return something intact to its rightful owner
forged book/book of dubious authenticity/misattributed book/Apocrypha
to relieve sb of his post/to sack/to demote/dismissal/sacking
to eliminate/to sack/to remove from office
Zhang Juzheng (1525-1582), Grand Secretary during the Ming dynasty, credited with bringing the dynasty to its apogee
(of an official) corrupt and negligent of his duty
to cross the sea by a trick (idiom)/to achieve one's aim by underhanded means
